entries.player_1_1: Sure.  I've already dealt with her thugs in the past.  This shouldn't be a problem.
entries.player_1_2: This is beginning to sound interesting.  Count me in!
entries.player_1_3: I've come this far, haven't I?  I'll see this to the end!
entries.player_2_1: I'm tired of dealing with Valarian's thugs. They're not much of a challenge.
entries.player_2_2: If you can't get away from working on those repulsorlifts, what makes you think you can pull this off?  Count me out.
entries.player_2_3: I have a bad feeling about this.  I'm going to have to say no from hereon.
entries.player_3_1: What are you planning?  Something I shouldn't know about?
entries.player_3_2: The suspense is killing me.  What's your scientist friend going to do with the code cylinder?
entries.npc_1_1: Hey you!  I heard you been doing favors for Jabba's cronies.  Maybe you can help me, huh?  I got a plan to earn my freedom from Jabba. But first I need to grab a special code cylinder from one of Valarian's thugs. You think you can get that cylinder for me?
entries.npc_1_2: This is the cylinder I wanted, but I can't crack the code. I need someone to take the cylinder to a scientist I know.  He can decode it.  Want the job?
entries.npc_1_3: Good work. The cylinder had a self-destruct code for one of Lady Valarian's storehouses. I'll give you the coordinates to the warehouse, but you'll need to punch in the code. Then run.
entries.npc_2_1: Good, good. Here's where you can find the roughneck. Once you've settled your business, bring me that code cylinder.  Meanwhile, I've got to get back to working on Jabba's collection of repulsorlifts, or he might decide he doesn't need me anymore, if you know what I'm sayin'...
entries.npc_2_2: Good. Take the cylinder to my friend. Check back with me after you've delivered it.
entries.npc_2_3: Good. You're earnin' my trust.  When you're done, come back here and tell me all about the blast. And don't forget to run.
entries.npc_3_1: Hey, I can understand that. I'm just one of Jabba's slaves, right?  I'll be sure to let Bib know just how helpful you were to Jabba's personal mechanic.
entries.npc_3_2: You're missing out on a payin' job.  But I'll get this done with or without your help!
entries.npc_3_3: Hnh. Suit yourself. I can find someone else to take this job, if you don't want it.
entries.npc_4_1: Don't ask so many questions. I'll tell you what you need to know, when you need to know it.
entries.npc_4_2: I need this cylinder scanned for security measures. I don't want to be walking into any traps. And I'll need copies made. It's all part of my plan. But quit asking questions and just get to work.
entries.npc_4_3: There's a terminal there that has a self destruct sequence on it.  Just set it and get out of there.
entries.npc_reward_1: Good work gettin' that cylinder. I knew you were looking for the trouble.  Let me make sure this thing isn't wired, and then we'll talk about the next part of my plan.  And here, I had these laying around, I figured you've earned a little bonus.
entries.npc_reward_2: My friend contacted me. The cylinder is clean and copies have been made. I'm thinkin' you can be trusted to handle the next phase of my plan.  Oh, and one of the Gamorrean's stumbled across this.  He wouldn't say where he got em, but I suspect there's a visitor missing.  Heh, I'll give it to you.
entries.npc_reward_3: Good work! Tell me everything. Was it loud? How hot was it? Was the explosion a ball of flame, or a column of fire? I wish I could have been there! Anyway, Jabba thinks my plan was a good one. He's promised me my freedom, but I still got a debt to work off... Oh, but I do have this for you.
entries.next: You better head to the throne room and see Bib.  He's expecting ya.
entries.notyet: You shouldn't be down here.  Why don't you head back upstairs and see if anyone needs some work done.  Try Porcellus.
entries.npc_backtowork: Get back to work, I ain't got time to chat.
entries.npc_work_1: Hey, did you get my cylinder?
entries.npc_work_3: Did it blow up?  Or have you not gone yet?
entries.player_reset: I need to take a breather and try this again later.
entries.player_sorry: Oh, yeah, I'll get back to work.
entries.npc_breech_1: Jabba's thugs eh?  You'll be no match for us.
entries.npc_smuggle_2: That's the code Barada's looking for.  Let me know what happens.
entries.npc_failure_1: They said you could do anything, but I guess I heard wrong about you.
entries.npc_failure_2: What, are you a bolthead? All I asked you was to deliver an object for me, and you couldn't even do that? I guess I've got to get back to work.
entries.npc_failure_3: You ruined everything that I was working for! Now how am I gonna get out of being a slave to Jabba? Thanks alot...
entries.notit: What's this?  Where's the item I asked for?
